text: A full moon pokes a white hole in a black sky. 0.S. we hear FESTIVE ROCK ‘N ROLL and the WHOOPS and HOLLERS of JOYFUL REVELERS. We PAN DOWN TO Spooky Island, a tropical island/theme park. This cheesy tourist trap is hardly a Disneyland or Magic Mountain, nor even, sad to say, a Legoland. Like Rome, it was not built in a day. Unlike Rome, it very well likely could have been. We PASS a colorful Fiberglass “haunted" castle that sits atop a small mountain. We PASS palm trees and huge papier mache heads impaled on stakes. We APPROACH a lit sign that reads: °

head_text.subj: WELCO E TO SP ORY ISLAND
WHERE FEAR IS Y UR ONLY FRIEND

text: We MOVE PAST the sign and OUT OVER a crowd of college students. Dancing. Partying. Pouring beer on themselves and each other. Men in skeleton costumes pounce out of the shadows frightening nary a soul. We MOVE TO a film crew following a pretty, peppy REPORTER. The Reporter walks through the young people. We MOVE WITH her. She speaks loudly to be heard over the revelry.

Students the world over are trading in the sandy beaches of Florida for a completely different Spring Break experience here on Spooky Island! The Reporter arrives at a large-breasted LASS in a bikini.
What’s your name?
Barbara!
Has your experience here on Spooky Island been, well, spooky?
Last night I threw up five times! That was kinda whacked! (CONTINUED)

We MOVE ON, PAST cardboard gravestones wobbling in the WIND. PAST island natives -- that is, employees of various ethnicities wearing grass skirts and war paint -- holding a limbo stick for students. PAST a hunchback boinking giggling visitors with a plush hammer. We ARRIVE AT a rocky mountainside, where a young, sullen- looking woman, ISABEL ROGERS, sits on the stoop of a fake gallows. Isabel is "Goth." She wears all black. Her hair is dyed black and gelled into tall spikes. Her eyes are circled by thick, dark rings of makeup. Two fat, sweaty students slam their hairy bellies together in front of her.

This place sucks. Isabel’s friend MANDY stands beside her, peering through a tiny window on a door that reads "STAFF ONLY." The door leads into the mountainside. Mandy is a pretty, fresh-faced blonde with a pierced nose.
No dizz-oubt. I can’t see nothing. Mandy tries the doorknob. It’s not locked.
Whoa. Hey, Isabel, come on.
Why would you want to go in there? Mandy enters the staff doorway.
Better than frat central out here. Isabel looks around nervously. She slips in behind Mandy.
Mandy and Isabel peer down a long stretch of a dark cavernous hall. We hear WATER DRIPPING.
Weird. (CONTINUED)

They should let us come in here, man. S’way scarier than those Silence of the Lambs bumper boats. Isabel and Mandy creep down the hall. They discover an adjoining hallway to their right. Planks of wood cover the rocky walls. Mandy heads down it.
Mandy, let’s go back, okay?
Isabel follows Mandy down the hall. After a moment, Isabel looks behind her. A pair of fiery red eyes are staring at them.
Mandy... Mandy turns around. She sees the eyes.
Ha! It’s another one of those animatronic demon thingama-whats! Mandy struts down the hall and toward the eyes.
They want us to come in here! It’s set up to be part of the- park! Mandy gets closer and sees what’s actually standing there. Her expression drops.
Yeah?

Run!! Mandy twirls around. She starts to dash, but something in the dark grabs her. She falls to her belly. She screams. Isabel sees her yanked back, disappearing into the darkness. The SCREAMING STOPS. (CONTINUED)
Isabel takes off down the hall. The eyes follow her. The hallway ends in a "T." Isabel darts left.

Isabel flees from the fiery eyes. Large wooden doors line the hall on both sides. She spots red eyes approaching in front of her as well as behind. She tries one door. Locked. She tries another. It swings open. She throws herself inside. .

Isabel slams the door behind her. She clamps a wooden slab in place, locking it. She turns. The enormous CREATURES SLAM on the door. A phone sits on a desk. She picks it up. Dials. Sobs. O.S. the PHONE RINGS. An ANSWERING MACHINE PICKS UP.
You have reached the Rogers residence. Please leave a message at the beep. Beep! No, not that one -- ha ha! This one: The MACHINE BEEPS.
Daddy, please pick up! Some type of demon is chasing me! It just got Mandy! Please, Daddy -- The DOOR SHATTERS beside her. Isabel screams. She drops the phone and runs through another door.

Isabel slams shut another door behind her. Deadbolts it. She turns. She sees: . The walls of the room are plastered with newspaper clippings, magazine articles, and photographs. She looks quickly from one to the other:

reads, "TEENAGE SLEUTHS REVEAL BLACK KNIGHT GHOST AS HOAX." A photo pictures the Mystery, Incorporated gang: Shaggy Rogers, Fred Jones, Daphne Blake, Velma Dinkley, and the huge Great Dane, Scooby-Doo.
reads, "MYSTERY INC. SOLVE ENIGMA OF JUMPING GHOST CLOWN: Springs on Bottom of Shoes." There is a photo of the gang with the aforementioned shoes.
with Scooby-Doo and a cyclops monster eating Scooby Snacks reads: "Scooby and the Cyclops have this mystery solved: Scooby Snacks are DELICIOUS!"
Isabel stares at the articles, confused, and whispers:
Scooby-Doo? The DOOR CRASHES down. Isabel screams in horror. The SCOOBY-DOO THEME SONG begins.

The CREDIT SEQUENCE is a MONTAGE of historical records: PANS of magazine and newspaper articles, old Tv footage, and interviews documenting the rise and fall of Mystery, Inc. The following are some of the snippets for inclusion:
A Host stands on a colorful, Peter Max-ish studio set for a cheesy variety show.
Now, as promised, the four young detectives who defeated the Black Knight Ghost! The audience applauds wildly. (CONTINUED)
Fred Jones! -
Fred Jones jogs down a set of stairs. He’s a handsome teen with a healthy blonde mane. He wears a white sweater and a red ascot. He gives thumbs-up.
Daphne Baker!
Daphne Blake, a gorgeous redhead, trots down the other side. She waves. She wears an eggplant and pink outfit and a lime scarf.
Shaggy Rogers!

Shaggy Rogers runs down another set of stairs. He is a skinny teenage dude, with a scruffy goatee and a messy mop of hair. He wears a green T-shirt and brown boot-cut corduroys. He holds his arms up in triumph.
Velma Dinkley!
Velma Dinkley, a stocky tomboy, walks out modestly. She wears thick spectacles that distort her eyes and an orange cowl-neck sweater. She smiles politely and nods.
And Scooby-Doo!

Here comes Scooby, leaping like a joyous idiot onto the stage. He’s the familiar tongue-wagging canine we know and love, brown with black spots, gargantuan, goofy, and gangly. He slides toward us happily until he realizes he’s sliding toward the edge of the stage. He panics, trying to stop himself, but is unable. He falls into the front row. Scooby’s head pops up amongst the crowd. He chuckles his trademark laugh.

The headline reads: "MYSTERY INC. STOPS HEADLESS HORSEMAN’S WAVE OF MAYHEM WITH FIRE HOSE." It features a grainy photo of the gang spraying a fire hose at the "Headless Horseman“ on his white mare. TV FOOTAGE - INT. “TONIGHT SHOW" SET The gang sits on the couch beside Jay Leno.
Tell me, how'd you know this headless horse-guy wasn’t real?
I noticed the upper half of his body was too large for his frame. No one’s built like that. There was room for a whole head up there.
Hal Perceptive!
Freddy’s so like all a genius! The audience applauds. Scooby bows. Velma looks upset.
VELMA, like the rest of the gang in these PRESENT DAY interviews, is a few years older, in her early twenties.
I was the one who noticed the Headless Horseman’s body was too big. And I sat there thinking, now Jay Leno will believe it was Fred, forever.
The gang is mobbed by teen fans seeking autographs.
Dreamy photo of an airbrushed Fred.
Photo of Daphne, pretty and sweet in a purple, pink, lime flowered dress. -
Photo of Velma. Headline: "Velma Dinkley’s Gaming Tips."
Photo of Shaggy jamming on a guitar.
They like treated me like their personal slave. Finally I said, hey, I’m a detective!
I said, if you’re a detective, then name one thing you’ve detected!
So I said, okay -- I detect that the only thing you’re good for is getting captured and tied up by bad guys! How’s that!?
(teary-eyed) I couldn’t believe he’d say that to me.
Headline: "FAMOUS DOG INKS SIX FIGURE DEAL TO HAWK "SCOOBY SNACKS" with a black and white headshot of Scooby.
I know Scooby’s a dog and - everything, but even considering all that he’s a moron.
A closeup of Scooby-Doo. He grins and holds up a bag of Scooby Snacks (TM).
Ren I’m rungry I reat Rooby Racks!
Cut! Mr. Doo, you must enunciate.
Rooby rat rar rurry ren err--
Cut! I couldn’t understand a bloody word he said.
Scooby looks angry. He speaks without passion.
Ren I’m rungry Roob Racks --
Cut! Dammit!
Heading: “MYSTERY INC. DEBUNKED! Teen Sherlocks call it quits after three troubled years," featuring a photo of the gang in happier days.
There comes a time to separate the wheat from the chaff. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
FRED (CONT’D) The four of them are wheat and I’m the chaff. (beat) Of the other way around. Whichever is the good one, that’s the one I am.
So finally I quit.
I said, I’m out of here, okay?!
Rood-rye and rood riddance!

To paraphrase Johnny Mathis, I said, ‘Take this job and shove it!’ I mean, I like didn’t say it right then. But I thought of it later, and, boy, I wished I had. END CREDIT SEQUENCE. EXT. SHAGGY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Rain falls on this ramshackle, gray, suburban home. The lawn is overgrown. The roof is caving in. The gutter hangs. Duct tape keeps a cracked window in place. O.S., a PHONE RINGS. INT. SHAGGY’S KITCHEN A rotary phone sits on a counter crowded with dirty pots and pans. Drops of RAIN PLINK against a window behind it. The PHONE RINGS again. (CONTINUED)
A dog’s front paw picks up the receiver. Scooby-Doo brings the phone to his ear. He yawns, sleepy-eyed. He’s just woken up. The rain on the window projects curling shadows onto the fur of his face.
Rello?
Scooby! ?
Yeah, yeah. Rooby reaking.
(erying) This is Shaggy’s Uncle Garret. It’s my daughter, Isabel. I got a call from her on Spooky Island -- Scooby’s eyes flood with fear.
Rooky! ?
She claimed she was being chased by some sort of demon -- !
Remons?! Scooby slams down the receiver, hanging up on Garret. He stares at it, fearfully. The PHONE RINGS again. Scooby picks it up, attempting a Spanish accent:
Hola!?
Scooby, I’m not an idiot! I know this is you!
El robody-o rame-o el Roobido here. Scooby hangs up the phone again. He paces back and forth. Dog whines. Bites his nails. (CONTINUED)
It RINGS again. Scooby picks it up as if it were a dead pet. He holds the receiver a few inches from his ear.
Put my nephew on the phone! He’s -- Scooby looks up to see a dark shape stumbling out of the bedroom toward him.
Scooby-Doo... where are you? Shaggy Rogers stumbles into the bedroom doorway. He is in his green T-shirt and tightie-whities. He scratches his butt. He squints to shut out the light. 7
Who is it? Scooby quickly hangs up the phone, futilely hoping Shaggy won't notice.
Robody.
Come on, man. Like I just watched you on the phone. Scooby shakes his head, denying it. He’s a total liar. THUNDER CRACKS. The PHONE RINGS. Shaggy reaches for the phone. Scooby jumps to block him.

The Coolsville campus is nearly abandoned for spring break. A couple kids play Frisbee with a golden retriever. INT. GARRET ROGERS’ OFFICE PROFESSOR GARRET ROGERS weeps. He is a stout man with glasses too small for his bald skull. He sits in an ergonomic chair. A framed photo of Shaggy and Isabel, smiling with their arms slung over each other’s shoulders, is propped on his desk. Advanced degrees cover his walls. A nervous Scooby and Shaggy are seated with him. A tape recorder plays on his desk. (CONTINUED )
Some type of demon is chasing me! It just got Mandy! Please, Daddy -- We hear the DOOR SHATTER; ISABEL SCREAMS, the PHONE DROPS; the LINE GOES DEAD. Garret hits the stop button.
The police won’t do anything! They said it’s a haunted theme park, it’s normal for people to get panicked calls!
When’s Isabel supposed to get back?
At the end of spring break. A week from tomorrow.
Maybe we should like wait until --
No! Something strange is going on. These Spooky Island reps won’t let me speak to my own daughter. Garret pushes forward two open Coolsville U yearbooks on his desk.
What’s this?

I’ve done some research. These three students all went to the Island last year. Three students’ photos are circled in pencil. Angel Fawn is a Mohawked-punk rocker. Andrew Cozine is a black rapper with wraparound sunglasses and shapes shaved in his hair. Floyd Pepper is a Deadhead wearing a tie-dyed shirt.
These yearbooks belong to the library! You could get in trouble for drawing on them! (CONTINUED)

Garret shows them two newer yearbooks next to the old ones. The same students’ pictures aré circled. Angel’s hair is now blonde and permed. Andrew sports glasses and a bow tie. Floyd is a crew-cutted jock. They are all smiling, happy and conservative.
These are their pictures from this year, since they’ve returned.
zoinks.

In addition to their appearance, their G.P.A.’s have risen dramatically. They were formally disciplinary problems, but no longer. Angel, she edits the school paper. Floyd’s become the quarterback for the Coolsville Flower Powers... What do you think it could be?!
It’s probably... a magic potion. Garret grips tightly to Shaggy’s forearm, breaking down. Fluids drip from his nose.
A magic potion? Dear Lord! Shaggy, you have to go to Spooky Island! You have to find Isabel! You have to solve this mystery!
Uncle Garret, stuff from your nose is touching my arm!! Shaggy yanks his arm away.
I don’t know how to do a mystery --
You were a profession detective for four years!
Yeah, but I wasn’t, you know, like paying attention! (CONTINUED)
Garret places some cash on the table.
My savings. Do whatever you need to find my baby princess. And I have something here for Scooby, if he’1l go with you.
Ro way! Garret pulls a bag of Scooby Snacks (TM) out of a vase.
Rooby Racks?! Scooby rolls over on the carpet like a nincompoop. He knocks over an end table and lamp. Garret looks at Shaggy.

He’s doing tricks. That’s rolling over. Scooby unsheathes a display sword from the wall over the desk. He pretends to repeatedly stab himself by jabbing the sword in his armpit. He falls onto his back.
Playing dead.
Scooby, the whole bag is yours if you go to this Spooky Island and find my daughter. Scooby stands.
Rokay! I’11 rill the remons!
Scooby slashes the sword, growling ferociously.
Uncle Garret, Fred and Velma figured out everything. I was just the guy that carried their bags.
Then get your friends to come along. (CONTINUED)
We haven’t spoken in two years.

Please. You love Isabel as much as I do. Shaggy stares compassionately at his uncle. It’s obvious he does love his cousin. Just then, Scooby, pretending to be a swashbuckler, accidentally slices Shaggy’s shoulder with the sword.
OQw!! Why are you playing with a sword?! Scooby points at Garret.
Re did it.
No, he didn’t! I was looking at him!

Welcome to the 28th Annual Coolsville Science Fiction Convention. Awkward fan boys, middle-aged men dressed as superheroes, and B-movie starlets in skimpy femalien costumes cross in front of a placard outside an auditorium. The placard reads:
FRED JONES, discussing his new book, E.S.P./Schmee. S.P.
FRED JONES at a podium. He holds a remote control. Only ten or so bored fans sit in the large auditorium.
And then there was the time, of course, when I solved the mystery of -- Fred presses the remote, flashing a... Slide of a phony seaweed monster. (CONTINUED)
-- the seaweed-covered ghost,~ exposing him as... Fred clicks to a slide of the seaweed-covered ghost, unmasked. Slide Slide Slide Slide
++. aman in a mask. of the Aztec ghost, chasing Shaggy.
The Aztec ghost was quite a challenge until I discovered -- of the Aztec ghost, unmasked.
That he was a man in an Aztec ghost mask. of the abominable snowman ghost.
But I guess you’d say I’m most remembered for revealing to the world that the abominable snowman ghost -- of the abominable snowman ghost, unmasked.
Was actually a man inside of a ma. Kk. BOY raises his hand.
Do you think there’s such a real thing as a real ghost?

My new book, E.S.P./Schmee.S.P., addresses that issue, my friend. After years of investigating supernatural claims I have arrived at one utter and unassailable conclusion: There are no such entities as ghosts, ghouls, goblins, or monsters. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

At the end of every paranormal claim there are only fools seeking fame, paranoid imaginations, or charlatans looking to make a buck. There is absolutely -- absolutely -- no suc’ hi: as magic in this world. Beat.
Any other questions? A maladjusted FAT KID raises his hand.

Yeah. Why do you suck? The other kids in the auditorium crack up. Fred smiles, blushes, attempts to be a good sport, when he spots... Shaggy and Scooby in the rear of the auditorium. Scooby waves excitedly.
Shagster?
Fred sits with Shaggy and Scooby. The yearbooks and a tape recorder are in front of him.
Well, it’s obvious some sort of man in a mask apprehended your cousin. The important question is... What kind of mask?
So you’1l go with us?
Can’t, Shag. My book tour. Tomorrow I’m off to Evanston, I --
But what about these pictures?
It’s either a coincidence, or they all got jobs at Disneyland. (CONTINUED)
Or a magic potion.
Shaggy. There is no such thing as supernatural phenomena.
Like you’re leaving out the proven entities, right?
Such as?
Leprechauns.
Ralking relerons!
Yeah, walking skeletons.
Rankenrerries.
Right, Fr -- No, Scoob. Frankenberry’s a guy on a cereal box. (to Fred) Right? He’s not a real guy, is he? Fred is struck by an idea.
It could be a hypno-wheel.
Those red-and-white twirly things that make you act like a chicken?
(nodding) Amnesty International has declared hypno-wheels a violation of basic human rights, ever since Pol Pot employed one during the Khmer Rouge. (CONTINUED)
Think of it, Fred! That’d be the kind of thing that could get a guy, like, global press. Right?
(smiling) Out of rinky-dink fan conventions and back on Leno. INT. PSYCHOLOGIST’S OFFICE A group sits in a circle of chairs. A PSYCHOLOGIST reads from a list on her clipboard.
Velma Dinkley... Why don’t you tell us why you enrolled in group therapy? Velma Dinkley is within the circle. She has a difficult time sharing her feelings.
My fellow students in the Ph.D. mathematics program told me I was...
Bitter?
I was in a group for a long time where I didn’t get the credit I deserved. No one noticed me, and...
What was the group?
(mumbling) Mystery, Incorporated.
The guys with the big dog?
Scooby-Doo?
Right! And Fred Jones. (CONTINUED)
Velma nods, uncomfortable, half-attempting a smile.
Yeah! They had that chick, Daphne.
Oh my God, she was hot! She was Bo hot!
Which one were you?
Velma... She just said my name a second ago.

I don’t remember a Thelma. EXT. PSYCHOLOGIST’S PARKING LOT - LATER Velma exits the office with the other patients. She doesn’t socialize. She heads to her Dodge. She hears a CAR HONK. And turns. The colorful Mystery Machine van is here. It’s rusted, beaten, and faded. Fred, Shag, and Scoob wait in it.
Jinkies.
Velma sits in the parked van with Shaggy and Fred.
Where’d you find the Mystery Machine?
I tracked it down on eBay a couple years back! I charge fans fifteen bucks for a ride around the block. An angry Scoob is tightly crossing his arms in the back seat.
What’s wrong with him? (CONTINUED)
He’s still miffed you called him a moron when we were breaking up.
Well, Scoob, you have to admit -- relatively speaking, measured against a human, you are a moron. Scooby, offended, snatches a notebook off the back seat. He furiously writes something on it.
So, Velma, are you in? This’1ll be a real doozy of a news story if all five of us go.
On one condition. When we announce the hypno-wheel to the press, I take the TV interviews. Scooby shows the notebook to Velma, to prove that he’s not a moron. It reads: 12 +7
That’s not right. Scooby fiddles with the equation. Fred looks at Shaggy.
But it’s tradition that I do that.
Fine. Forget it.
Breaking tradition, that’s like... hanging turds on a Christmas tree.
I rid rat once.
Don’t remind me, Scoob! Velma sits, saying nothing, staring forward.
Well... Heck, all right. (CONTINUED)
Fred ruffles Velma’s hair like a little kid. She angrily slaps his hand away.
Scooby, Shaggy, Velma, and Fred cross the garden toward a dojo. Scooby is still writing in the notebook. A sign reads "TAI CHI ACADEMY."
Okay, when we get in there, just follow my lead. Daphne’s not going to want to go because of Fred.
Why? She digs me. Scooby holds up the notebook again: 12 +7
No. Velma opens the door. A martial arts match is occurring.

Daphne, in a dashing eggplant karate robe with a lime belt, is taking on numerous students at once. An INSTRUCTOR watches. She karate chops an attacking Asian student in the neck. Two students hurl themselves toward her. She somersaults over them. She downs one with a swipe to the spine and another with a heel to the kidney. Daphne stands frozen, crouched, her fist out in front of her in Flying Lotus stance. The students lie in mangled pain around her.
Excellent, Daphne-san. You are learning to harness your chi. They hear clapping. Daphne turns to see the gang. (CONTINUED)
What are you doing here? - (to Fred) Especially you?
Hey. Don’t be sharp just ‘cause Freddy gave you the heave-ho.
(to Fred) Re ras rinky.
I was stinky?!
Clingy. He said you were clingy.
I broke up with you, Freddy!
Mystery Ink is reforming.
Yippee. My answer’s no way!
I understand. Let’s go, guys. Everyone, following Velma’s lead, starts to leave. This startles Daphne.
Where are you go -- What do you mean, ‘you understand?’
It’s easy for us. But for you, always getting captured and tied up, always having to be saved by someone else. I can see where being the damsel in distress is humiliating.
But I’m not like that anymore! I’ve slowly kind of turned my body into sort of a dangerous weapon! Velma smiles patronizingly. She and the others exit. (CONTINUED)
Daphne stands, agonized, torn. She beats her hands against her forehead, Annette Bening-style. Then she succumbs.
Dammit. Wait!
A plane takes off overhead.
Daphne stands with Velma.

Those guys are gonna look like total, total idiots when they’re captured and then I’m the one that’s saving them!... Scooby, hold still! She's putting lipstick on a distracted Scooby. He wears a gray wig, floppy bonnet, and a pair of teardrop, jewelry-studded glasses. Daphne holds an old lady's driver’s license up beside his face.
What do you think? Does he look like my grandma-ma? Velma stares without expression at Daphne.
Fred wheels his luggage to a list of TWA departure times. The board lists flights to L.A., St. Louis, New York, as well as one flight to Spooky Island, leaving at 4:10.
expertly plays a fifty cent crane machine. The grabber grips a stuffed dragon. Shaggy guides it into the slot. Hoots triumphantly. Spots Fred.
Fred! Check out all these things I wont! Pred eyes a pile of stuffed creatures beside Shaggy. (CONTINUED)
Cool. Where are k.d. lang and Malibu Barbie?
Disguising Scooby. Like, ‘cause if he has to ride in a kennel he gets all claustrophobic. Fred, horrified, sees something down the hall behind Shag.
Oh my God.
is having a heck of a time staying upright in high heels. Daphne helps him walk. His body wavers and jerks. A YOUNG BOY and his MOMMY pass Scooby. The Boy points.
Mommy, what’s wrong with that lady? Mommy smiles at Scooby. She speaks out of the side of her mouth while shoving her son’s pointing finger down.
Be nice, Larry. She has a disease. Daphne whispers to Scooby.
Good boy. Just keep your balance. They arrive at Shaggy and Fred. A pleased Scooby freakishly grins and gives them the thumbs-up.
Rooby rockin’ good!? Velma won’t look directly at him.
Make him cut that out. It’s creepy. Fred theatrically throws his palm downward in the middle of the gang. The others stare at him. (CONTINUED)
What? -
Before we get on the plane, let’s do that thing where we put our hands on top of each other, then lift them up and go, ‘Whoo hoo!’
Rokay! Scooby puts his paw on Fred’s hand.
Roo _ hoo!
Wait for everybody, Scoob.
Rorry. Fred stares at the others, pumped up, grinning widely.
I’m not going to do it unless Velma and Shaggy do it.
People are watching. Velma shakes her head a little and grimaces. The three of them walk away. Fred and Scooby stand alone, their fake smiles fading, their hands on top of each other.
Roo hoo?
An AIRPORT CLERK collects tickets at the gate. Passengers file by.
Please have I.D. ready with your ticket! Daphne shows the Clerk her driver’s license. (CONTINUED )

The Clerk nods, rips her ticket, and Daphne passes through. - Shaggy, peering nervously back, gives him his ticket and ID. The Clerk rips his ticket, and Shaggy passes through. Scooby hands the Clerk his ticket and ID. The Clerk looks at the photo of Daphne’s grandmother. Scooby, pretending to have no teeth, does a melodramatic senior citizen voice.
I’m a rittle old rady! The Clerk stares at him. Velma, behind Scooby, explains.
Since that photo my grandmother’s contracted acromegaly. (whispered) The Elephant Man disease. The Clerk nods sympathetically. He rips the ticket.
God bless you, ma’am.
The plane soars over the sunset and wispy clouds.

College students abound, many of them tattooed punks and Goth rockers and hippies. Scooby, Shaggy, and Fred sit across the aisle from an upper crust coed. Scooby notices a cat in a Sherpa bag in the space at the feet of the coed. The CAT HISSES at him. Scooby, still dressed as the old lady, growls. His lip rolls up. The coed gives Scooby an uneasy look.
(sotto voce) Scooby, cut it out. Scooby stops. (CONTINUED)
Rorry. 7 Fred has hypno-wheel notes and diagrams on a tray in front of him. But he ignores them for a moment, staring longingly at Daphne, who sits a couple rows down.
You still have like a thing for her, don’t you? Fred looks at him.
Daphne.
That’s ludicrous.
Then what’s this? Shaggy points to some doodles next to Fred’s notes: hearts that read "Fred + Daphne 4ever," and the like, and poorly-drawn pictures of Daphne. Fred scrambles and shuts it.
Don’t be touching my private things! The CAT HISSES at Scooby again. Scooby loses it, barking at the cat. Everyone looks at the barking old lady.
Scooby!
Shaggy, it’s simple behavior modification. To cause a dog to discontinue any action, you flick him on the nose. Observe. Scoob? Scooby turns to Fred.
When you bark, this is what happens. Fred flicks Scooby on the nose. Scooby stares a moment. Then he punches Fred eight times in the face, hard.  30.

The gang and students descend a stairwell from the plane. Scooby tears away his disguise, and gazes out at: A cobblestone walkaway leads from the plane onto this eighth-rate Disneyland. Natives line the walkway. They vend skull key chains, T-shirts, and plastic leis formed to resemble intestines. LOUDSPEAKERS emit SCARY MUSIC.

Okay, gang, let’s spread that photo of Isabel around, see if anyone knows her. Then we’ll see if we can locate the hyno-wheel. The gang fans out at the bottom of the stairg. They each have a photograph of Isabel, which they show to the natives. Daphne stands with one EMPLOYEE.
She came in last week. Isabel Rogers. Have you seen her?
